docs.lead_paragraph: Steve McQueen's death 25 years ago this month ended a bizarre drama in which he surreptitiously traveled to Mexico for an unorthodox cancer treatment. The medical profession largely derided McQueen as a victim of fraud, but to some people with cancer, his pursuit of an alternative treatment seemed heroic.
docs.snippet: Steve McQueen's death 25 years ago this month ended a bizarre drama in which he surreptitiously traveled to Mexico for an unorthodox cancer treatment.

docs.lead_paragraph: Most children with sore throats are given antibiotics when they see their doctors, even though a large majority of the ailments are caused by organisms that do not respond to the drugs, a new study has found. The only common cause of sore throat that can be cured with an antibiotic is streptococcus infection, but it occurs in only 15 percent to 36 percent of cases of sore throat.

headline.main: One Simple Ailment, Many Wrong Prescriptions

docs.snippet: Most children with sore throats are given antibiotics by their doctors, even though a large majority of the ailments are caused by organisms that do not respond to the drugs.
